intro: Saurauia aguaricana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian starfruit or yellow starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru, where it grows in high-altitude forests. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow-orange berries that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Saurauia aguaricana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species and contributing to forest biodiversity.
